summary: This bill, the Retired Law Enforcement Officers Continuing Service Act, establishes a grant program to help state, local, tribal, and territorial law enforcement agencies hire retired law enforcement personnel to perform civilian law enforcement tasks. These tasks include assisting in investigations (homicide, carjacking, financial crimes), compliance, evidence review, and providing technology expertise. The bill outlines definitions, grant authorization, accountability measures (including audits and exclusions for unresolved findings), and provisions to prevent duplicative grants.
